title: apply-stress-test-on-portfolio
text: Load internal datasets Define scenarios use
code: assets_testdata <- read.csv(system.file("testdata", "assets_testdata.csv", package = "trisk.model", mustWork=TRUE)) scenarios_testdata <- read.csv(system.file("testdata", "scenarios_testdata.csv", package = "trisk.model", mustWork=TRUE)) financial_features_testdata <- read.csv(system.file("testdata", "financial_features_testdata.csv", package = "trisk.model", mustWork=TRUE)) ngfs_carbon_price_testdata <- read.csv(system.file("testdata", "ngfs_carbon_price_testdata.csv", package = "trisk.model", mustWork=TRUE)) baseline_scenario <- "NGFS2023GCAM_CP" target_scenario <- "NGFS2023GCAM_NZ2050" scenario_geography <- "Global"

title: apply-stress-test-on-portfolio
text: Run model provided data, filtering assets available portfolio.

title: apply-stress-test-on-portfolio
text: Sample portfolio content (columns structure reproduce):
code: portfolio_testdata <- read.csv(system.file("testdata", "portfolio_testdata.csv", package = "trisk.analysis")) knitr::kable(portfolio_testdata) %>%   kableExtra::kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed")) %>%   kableExtra::scroll_box(width = "100%", height = "400px")

title: apply-stress-test-on-portfolio
text: Result dataframe :
code: analysis_data <- run_trisk_on_portfolio(   assets_data = assets_testdata,   scenarios_data = scenarios_testdata,   financial_data = financial_features_testdata,   carbon_data = ngfs_carbon_price_testdata,   portfolio_data = portfolio_testdata,   baseline_scenario = baseline_scenario,   target_scenario = target_scenario,   scenario_geography = scenario_geography) #> -- Matching assets to portfolio-- Start Trisk-- Processing Assets and Scenarios.  #> -- Transforming to Trisk model input.  #> -- Calculating baseline, target, and shock trajectories.  #> -- Calculating net profits.  #> -- Calculating market risk.  #> -- Calculating credit risk. knitr::kable(analysis_data) %>%   kableExtra::kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed")) %>%   kableExtra::scroll_box(width = "200%", height = "400px")

title: apply-stress-test-on-portfolio
text: ### Bonds&Loans risk
code: pipeline_crispy_npv_change_plot(analysis_data) pipeline_crispy_exposure_change_plot(analysis_data) pipeline_crispy_pd_term_plot(analysis_data) #> Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range #> (`geom_bar()`). pipeline_crispy_expected_loss_plot(analysis_data)

title: input-data-summary
text: Set download path Download data
code: trisk_inputs_folder <- file.path(".", "trisk_inputs") download_trisk_inputs(local_save_folder = trisk_inputs_folder) #> Download completed.

title: input-data-summary
code: scenarios <- read.csv(file.path(trisk_inputs_folder, "scenarios.csv")) number_of_scenario_per_sector <- scenarios %>%   distinct(scenario, sector, technology) %>%   group_by(sector, technology) %>%   summarise(n_scenarios = n()) #> `summarise()` has grouped output by 'sector'. You can override using the #> `.groups` argument. knitr::kable(number_of_scenario_per_sector) %>%   kableExtra::kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed")) %>%   kableExtra::scroll_box(width = "100%", height = "400px")

title: input-data-summary
text: Load downloaded data Run Trisk data
code: assets <- read.csv(file.path(trisk_inputs_folder, "assets.csv")) scenarios <- read.csv(file.path(trisk_inputs_folder, "scenarios.csv")) financial_data <- read.csv(file.path(trisk_inputs_folder, "financial_features.csv")) carbon_data <- read.csv(file.path(trisk_inputs_folder, "ngfs_carbon_price.csv")) st_results <- run_trisk_model(   assets_data = assets,   scenarios_data = scenarios,   financial_data = financial_data,   carbon_data = carbon_data,   baseline_scenario = "NGFS2023GCAM_CP",   target_scenario = "NGFS2023GCAM_NZ2050",   scenario_geography = "Global" ) #> -- Processing Assets and Scenarios.  #> -- Transforming to Trisk model input.  #> -- Calculating baseline, target, and shock trajectories.  #> -- Calculating net profits.  #> -- Calculating market risk.  #> -- Calculating credit risk. names(st_results) #> [1] "npv_results"          "pd_results"           "company_trajectories"

title: run-country-sensitivity-analysis
text: Sensitivity analysis allows us explore changes parameters affect results. example, show vary shock year multiple TRISK runs defining run parameters sensitivity analysis. can also perform sensitivity analysis filtered subset assets. example filters dataset country, runs analysis. Contrary simple run trisk “run_trisk” function, possible navigate multiple Trisk runs dataframe, using run_id column index. Consolidated NPV results Consolidated PD results Consolidated company trajectories Consolidated params dataframe
code: run_params <- list(   list(     scenario_geography = "Global",     baseline_scenario = "NGFS2023GCAM_CP",     target_scenario = "NGFS2023GCAM_NZ2050",     shock_year = 2030 # SHOCK YEAR 1   ),   list(     scenario_geography = "Global",     baseline_scenario = "NGFS2023GCAM_CP",     target_scenario = "NGFS2023GCAM_NZ2050",     shock_year = 2025 # SHOCK YEAR 2   ) ) # Run sensitivity analysis across multiple TRISK runs sensitivity_analysis_results <- run_trisk_sa(   assets_data = assets_testdata,   scenarios_data = scenarios_testdata,   financial_data = financial_features_testdata,   carbon_data = ngfs_carbon_price_testdata,   run_params = run_params,   country_iso2 = c("DE") # FILTER ASSETS ON COUNTRIES ) #> [1] "Starting the execution of 2 total runs" #> -- Processing Assets and Scenarios.  #> -- Transforming to Trisk model input.  #> -- Calculating baseline, target, and shock trajectories.  #> -- Calculating net profits.  #> -- Calculating market risk.  #> -- Calculating credit risk.  #> [1] "Done 1 / 2 total runs" #> -- Processing Assets and Scenarios.  #> -- Transforming to Trisk model input.  #> -- Calculating baseline, target, and shock trajectories.  #> -- Calculating net profits.  #> -- Calculating market risk.  #> -- Calculating credit risk.  #> [1] "Done 2 / 2 total runs" #> [1] "All runs completed." knitr::kable(head(sensitivity_analysis_results$npv)) %>%   kableExtra::kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed")) %>%   kableExtra::scroll_box(width = "100%", height = "400px") knitr::kable(head(sensitivity_analysis_results$pd)) %>%   kableExtra::kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed")) %>%   kableExtra::scroll_box(width = "100%", height = "400px") knitr::kable(head(sensitivity_analysis_results$trajectories)) %>%   kableExtra::kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed")) %>%   kableExtra::scroll_box(width = "100%", height = "400px") knitr::kable(head(sensitivity_analysis_results$params)) %>%   kableExtra::kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed")) %>%   kableExtra::scroll_box(width = "100%", height = "400px")

title: run-country-sensitivity-analysis
code: plot_multi_trajectories(sensitivity_analysis_results$trajectories)

Additional arguments passed run_trisk_model.

what: Run TRISK sensitivity analysis on multiple scenarios — run_trisk_sa
title: Run TRISK sensitivity analysis on multiple scenarios — run_trisk_sa
text: function performs sensitivity analysis running TRISK model multiple scenarios. takes list parameter sets runs TRISK model set, returning comprehensive set results includes net present value (NPV), probability default (PD), company trajectories, model parameters.

title: Run TRISK sensitivity analysis on multiple scenarios — run_trisk_sa
code: run_trisk_sa(   assets_data,   scenarios_data,   financial_data,   carbon_data,   run_params,   ... )

title: Run TRISK sensitivity analysis on multiple scenarios — run_trisk_sa
text: assets_data Data frame containing asset information. scenarios_data Data frame containing scenario information. financial_data Data frame containing financial information. carbon_data Data frame containing carbon price information. run_params list parameter sets set contains required parameters single TRISK model run. parameter set must include `scenario_geography`, `baseline_scenario`, `target_scenario`, `shock_year`. Find definition Trisk parameters run_trisk_model ... Additional arguments passed get_filtered_assets_data (`country_iso2`, `sector`, `technology`, `company_name`).

title: Run TRISK sensitivity analysis on multiple scenarios — run_trisk_sa
text: list tibbles containing combined results runs. list includes tibbles NPV results (`npv`),         PD results (`pd`), company trajectories (`trajectories`), model parameters (`params`).
